title: Convenient Functions for Exploratory Data Analysis
text: Commonly, want generate quick summary variables dataset. Results can directly viewed flextable object. often helpful add label output indicating source file.
code: library(edar)  # Data  dat = mtcars |> dplyr::mutate(vs=factor(vs), am=factor(am))  # Summaries of all continuous variables in a data frame.  dat |> summ_by() #> Dropped: vs am #> Adding missing grouping variables: `name` #> # A tibble: 9 × 10 #>   name      n   nNA   Mean      SD   Min    P25    Med    P75    Max #>   <chr> <int> <int>  <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 carb     32     0   2.81   1.62   1      2      2      4      8    #> 2 cyl      32     0   6.19   1.79   4      4      6      8      8    #> 3 disp     32     0 231.   124.    71.1  121.   196.   326    472    #> 4 drat     32     0   3.60   0.535  2.76   3.08   3.70   3.92   4.93 #> 5 gear     32     0   3.69   0.738  3      3      4      4      5    #> 6 hp       32     0 147.    68.6   52     96.5  123    180    335    #> 7 mpg      32     0  20.1    6.03  10.4   15.4   19.2   22.8   33.9  #> 8 qsec     32     0  17.8    1.79  14.5   16.9   17.7   18.9   22.9  #> 9 wt       32     0   3.22   0.978  1.51   2.58   3.32   3.61   5.42  # Summaries of a selected variable after grouping.  dat |> summ_by(mpg,vs) #> Adding missing grouping variables: `vs` #> # A tibble: 2 × 10 #>   vs        n   nNA  Mean    SD   Min   P25   Med   P75   Max #>   <fct> <int> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 0        18     0  16.6  3.86  10.4  14.8  15.6  19.1  26   #> 2 1        14     0  24.6  5.38  17.8  21.4  22.8  29.6  33.9 dat |> summ_by(mpg,vs,am) #> Adding missing grouping variables: `vs`, `am` #> # A tibble: 4 × 11 #> # Groups:   vs [2] #>   vs    am        n   nNA  Mean    SD   Min   P25   Med   P75   Max #>   <fct> <fct> <int> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 0     0        12     0  15.0  2.77  10.4  14.0  15.2  16.6  19.2 #> 2 0     1         6     0  19.8  4.01  15    16.8  20.4  21    26   #> 3 1     0         7     0  20.7  2.47  17.8  18.6  21.4  22.2  24.4 #> 4 1     1         7     0  28.4  4.76  21.4  25.0  30.4  31.4  33.9  # Summaries of all categorical variables in a data frame.  dat |> summ_cat() #> Dropped: mpg cyl disp hp drat wt qsec gear carb #> $vs #>     vs  n percent #>      0 18  0.5625 #>      1 14  0.4375 #>  Total 32  1.0000 #>  #> $am #>     am  n percent #>      0 19 0.59375 #>      1 13 0.40625 #>  Total 32 1.00000 # Show data frame in a flextable object.  dat |> summ_by(mpg,vs) |> ft() # A label indicating the current source file with run time can be easily generated.  lab = label_src(1) # A source label can be directly added to the flextable output.  dat |> summ_by(mpg,vs) |> ft(src=1) # A source label can be easily added to a ggplot object.  library(ggplot2) p = ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) + geom_point()  p |> ggsrc()

what: edar: Convenient Functions for Exploratory Data Analysis — edar-package
title: edar: Convenient Functions for Exploratory Data Analysis — edar-package
text: collection convenient functions facilitate common tasks exploratory data analysis. common tasks include generating summary tables variables, displaying tables 'flextable' 'kable' showing distributions variables using 'ggplot2'. Labels stating source file run time can easily generated annotation tables plots.

text: Sugar function default flextable output.

title: flextable wrapper — ft
code: ft(d, fnote = NULL, ttl = NULL, sig = 8, dig = 2, src = 0, omit = "")

title: flextable wrapper — ft
text: d <dfr> data frame. fnote <chr> Footnote. ttl <chr> Title. sig <int> Number significant digits compute. dig <int> Number decimal places display. src <int> Either 1 2 add source label 1 2 lines. omit <chr> Text omit source label.

title: XY scatter plot wrapper — ggxy
text: Create basic XY scatter plot quick data exploration. Default show Pearson correlation coefficient p-value using ggpubr::stat_cor(). complex plots, recommended use ggplot2::ggplot2 directly.

title: XY scatter plot wrapper — ggxy
code: ggxy(d, x, y, ..., lm = TRUE, se = TRUE, cor = TRUE, pv = NULL)

title: XY scatter plot wrapper — ggxy
text: d <dfr> data frame. x <var> Variable x-axis unquoted name. y <var> Variable y-axis unquoted name. ... arguments ggplot2::aes additional mapping. lm <lgl> TRUE add regression line linear model. se <lgl> TRUE show standard error regression line. cor <lgl> TRUE show Pearson correlation coefficient p-value. pv <dbl> Precision p-value, e.g., 0.001 show 3 decimal places.

title: XY scatter plot wrapper — ggxy
text: ggplot object.

title: XY scatter plot wrapper — ggxy
code: mtcars |> ggxy(wt,hp) #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'  mtcars |> ggxy(wt,hp,col=factor(gear)) #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'  mtcars |> ggxy(wt,hp,col=factor(gear),pch=factor(am)) #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'  mtcars |> ggxy(wt,hp,pv=0.001) #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'  mtcars |> ggxy(wt,hp,se=FALSE) #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'  mtcars |> ggxy(wt,hp,lm=FALSE)  mtcars |> ggxy(wt,hp,cor=FALSE) #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
